title: War in Ukraine: Western embarrassment at North Korean involvement
summary: On Friday, NATO confirmed the deployment of soldiers sent by Pyongyang alongside Russian forces near Kursk.

title: Qatar suspends Gaza mediation until Israel and Hamas show 'seriousness,' says foreign ministry
summary: On the ground in the besieged Gaza Strip, the fighting showed no signs of abating on Saturday, the war's 400th day. The territory's civil defense agency said Israeli air strikes had killed at least 14 Palestinians overnight, including nine at a tent camp in the southern area of Khan Yunis.

title: How can the left fight the far right? Two philosophers' ideas for countering nationalism
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, Michaël Foessel and Bruno Karsenti analyze the driving forces behind the rise of xenophobic movements – from Marine Le Pen to Donald Trump – that challenge the rule of law, and how progressives can resist them.

title: EU vows 'unwavering' support for Ukraine after Trump win
summary: On the campaign trail, Trump cast doubt on maintaining the vast US military and financial aid to Ukraine and said he could cut a quick deal to end the war. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky had a congratulatory call with the president-elect on Wednesday, and plans for a potential meeting are underway, said Kyiv's top diplomat.

title: Tens of thousands march in Spain over handling of deadly floods
summary: The Valencia region was the worst hit by last month's floods, the most serious in decades, which killed at least 220 people and left towns and cities swamped with mud.

title: Five years after Notre-Dame fire, no culprit has been found as cathedral's long-awaited reopening nears
summary: Chief Paris prosecutor at the time of the initial investigation, Remy Heitz, said at the time he believed an accidental cause such as an electrical fault or smoldering cigarette butt was most likely. Since then, no new information has surfaced to suggest a deliberate arson.

title: French mass rape trial: Defendant Cédric G. gives disturbing testimony, says 'broke records' for deviancy
summary: On the stand on Friday, one of the over 50 men who raped Gisèle Pelicot, described himself as a disciple of the main accused, Dominique Pelicot.

title: Tracing fragments of the Berlin Wall, 35 years after it fell
summary: Thirty-five years after the fall of the Berlin Wall on the night of November 9, 1989, traces of the internal border that separated East and West Berlin for 28 years still remain in the German capital. Photographer Markus Schreiber has documented the remains of this historic symbol.

title: Rugby: New 20-minute red card tested during Autumn Internationals
summary: The French national rugby team takes on Japan at the Stade de France on Saturday and will have to deal with a new rule that could quickly become widespread.

title: Burkina Faso says Russia partnership is 'better suited' compared to France
summary: Burkina Faso was a French colony for the first half of the 20th Century, but relations soured with Paris following a 2022 military coup where the country embraced Russia's help in fighting against an Islamist insurgency.

title: Biden, Trump to meet at White House on Wednesday
summary: President Joe Biden extended a customary invitation to President-elect Donald Trump to meet at the Oval Office on Wednesday, November 13, following Trump's victory in the US presidential election.

title: Sonia Delaunay's fashion years
summary: During the interwar years, painting was not enough to sustain the Delaunay couple. So Sonia Delaunay began designing clothes and opened a fashion house in their Paris apartment. In Paris, the Zlotowski and Roger-Viollet galleries shed a light on this little-known facet of a complete artist.

title: Bodies wash up in Calais as questions raised about worst English Channel shipwreck of 2024
summary: Officially, three migrants died on October 23. But reports from relatives and survivors of the worst Channel crossing shipwreck of the year put the total number of victims at 15, mostly Eritreans and Syrians.

title: French rail unions calls for strike ahead of Christmas
summary: In a joint statement, the unions said the action would begin on December 11.

title: Coralie Fargeat, director of 'The Substance': 'I wanted to tell a story with nudity'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the filmmaker explained why the question of women's bodies is at the heart of her film.

title: Yascha Mounk: 'The problem isn't just the existence of populists, but the unpopularity of alternatives'
summary: In an interview, the political scientist analyzes the reasons for the defeat of the Democrats, who have cut themselves off from the realities of society, and its consequences for Europe, which has not prepared itself sufficiently after 2016.

title: Europe seeks to revive its economy in midst of economic downturn
summary: Meeting in Budapest, the 27 member states adopted a roadmap to help the EU catch up in terms of competitiveness. Donald Trump's reelection as US president makes the need for action even more urgent.

title: Will Paris FC escape the city's 'second big club' curse?
summary: Soon to be taken over by the Arnault family, the football club hopes to succeed where so many have failed: playing in the same league as PSG.

title: 2024 US Election: Donald Trump wins Arizona in final state results
summary: Trump, who was declared the 47th President of the United States on Wednesday, picked up another 11 electoral votes, giving him a total of 312 to Harris' 226. In the Sun Belt state, the president-elect campaigned on border security and the economy, tying Harris to inflation and record illegal border crossings during Biden’s administration.

title: Romania seeks to bring back its expatriates trained in high-tech sectors
summary: After a 15-year period during which 5 million Romanians went abroad, 82,000 more nationals returned to the country than left in 2023.

title: Science: Ancient DNA reveals the origins of Pompeii's inhabitants
summary: International researchers analyzed the genetic material of casts on victims of the Vesuvius eruption. Their kinship and gender do not match the stories told until now.

title: In Sweden, the prime minister's wife's clerical dress causes controversy
summary: Ulf Kristersson's wife, Birgitta Ed, was ordained a priest in January 2023. Since then, she's worn her clerical collar consistently, sparking heated debate in Sweden.

title: Ukrainians, Syrians, Afghans: The refugees who assemble Peugeot cars in France
summary: At Peugeot's historic Stellantis plant in eastern France, night shift teams boost production of the group's flagship model, the 3008. To recruit the 450 temporary workers for this team, the Group relies heavily on immigrants.

title: Life on hold: Three women from Gaza, stuck in Cairo with their children
summary: Israa, Hana and Juwan are trying to rebuild their lives with their children in Egypt, a country that tolerates their presence but does not recognize their rights.

title: 'The key to the future of telecommuting is balance between remote and office work'
summary: The revision of the rules governing telecommuting, which was widely introduced in companies during the Covid-19 pandemic, reflects the current tensions in the job market, and serves as a reminder of the benefits of regular employee presence in the office.
